channel.title: I just found a bug in RS
channel.description:
I just found a bug in RS that has let me copy a few unidentified herbs. Here's how the bug works: 1. I had 2 different types of unids next to each other (my lvl was too low to identify) 2. I grabbed 1 set of unids and moved it over to the slot next to it. (Note: you have to keep switching the items back and forth really fast until one copies) 3. One of the pile of unids used to have 6 herbs in it, but it had 7 after I did the bug, the other one had 7, but then it had 6, so I basically created an herb :)
Other people please try this and I want to know if it works for other items
p.s. it takes a long time for the items to "stick" and usually they just go back but I have gotten a few.

item.title: I just found a bug in RS
item.dc:creator: @M0rtion M0rtion
item.description:
@M0rtion wrote:

Try do it around 5000 ping, (tends to be when things starting gin crazy and u can dupe) switch it around lots, untill you get time right, then switch it back forth back fort (even if two come up keep going) untill your finger hurts, then equipt them item fast and requip another item… try it, just made it up o.o

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

My friends on around 256k speeds and he often gets small glitches that are funny. Switching from a chicken to another weapon and often the whack button from chicken shows on the other weapon(doesn’t work), small things like that.

Read full topic

item.title: I just found a bug in RS
item.dc:creator: @nicodk nicodk
item.description:
@nicodk wrote:

Moparisthebest:

It sounds like a lag issue, I have heard rumors of people ‘duping’ items with lag, but it doesn’t happen often if at all and is very hard to reproduce.

most bugs are caused by lag now.

you might be able to do it with other items.

its a bug they cant fix lucky ^^

Read full topic

item.source: I just found a bug in RS

item.title: I just found a bug in RS
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Click Here:

ive managed to get get 2 whips from the lag, but it vanished like two seconds later lol

That’s because of the way the system works, when it pages in memory from the disk you can read it twice if its backed up enough to not update it. And we all know how good Java is with speed and memory usage :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: I just found a bug in RS
item.dc:creator: @g00dg0d g00dg0d
item.description:
@g00dg0d wrote:

Ya, I get it all the time when Im playing Runescape with like 20 other programs in the backround where when I move a herb it is in two places but it always goes back. Ive actually done it with money too lol. Got a pic right before it changed back and I had two slots with money at one time.

Read full topic
item.source: I just found a bug in RS

item.title: I just found a bug in RS
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

It sounds like a lag issue, I have heard rumors of people ‘duping’ items with lag, but it doesn’t happen often if at all and is very hard to reproduce.

Agreed, you would have to either lag the system or hope they lag, and even then it would seem to not work in my opinion, but I know that if your lagging and move and switch items around in your inventory it dose ‘seem’ to change, but it usually corrects itself, unless the system lagged right at the second when you switched them and ‘seemed’ to dupe, it ‘might’.
But the possibility’s is like 100million:1

Read full topic

item.title: I just found a bug in RS
item.dc:creator: @rabcarl rabcarl
item.description:
@rabcarl wrote:

I just found a bug in RS that has let me copy a few unidentified herbs. Here’s how the bug works:

  1. I had 2 different types of unids next to each other (my lvl was too low to identify)
  2. I grabbed 1 set of unids and moved it over to the slot next to it. (Note: you have to keep switching the items back and forth really fast until one copies)
  3. One of the pile of unids used to have 6 herbs in it, but it had 7 after I did the bug, the other one had 7, but then it had 6, so I basically created an herb

Other people please try this and I want to know if it works for other items

p.s. it takes a long time for the items to “stick” and usually they just go back but I have gotten a few.
